title: How are virtual therapy apps trying to disrupt the mental health industry? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’m not sure that they are trying to do that. I would suppose that virtual therapy could disrupt the industry, much in the same way that Uber and AirBnB have done in their industry, without intending to do so. By offering a better, cheaper and faster product. For many mental health issues virtual therapy is an option, in particular I believe in prevention, an area that has been overlooked in large part by the mental health industry. So I’m guessing that virtual therapy could rob the mental health industry of their potential cliënts by offering something better, cheaper or faster, in particular when it comes to prevention.

Virtual therapy apps in mental healthcare are trying to provide self-help to the patient. As of now, these are limited to be used under the supervision of a qualified therapist and only in some cases. Further down the road, we might see wider application, but not now.
